description.narrative: Through its Cluster 4 programming, TMEA has designed interventions to address disruptions in food supply chains. The Supply chain Support for Resilience, Relief and Recovery for Cross-Border Food Security program aims to address barriers within the grain sector along the Busia and Namanga border crossings. The programme will deliver interventions across 2 thematic areas; • Trade Facilitation for targeted food supplies- trade Facilitation support to ease the movement of food supplies across borders paying particular attention to women cross border traders. • Enhancing Quality of Food Supplies- Support implementation of EAC SPS SOPs for cross-border trade in grains to ease clearance of goods at the targeted borders. Programme activities will be implemented in partnership with multiple beneficiaries, with component 1 focusing on support to the private sector through grant support to a market facilitator and component 2 through technical assistance to trade support agencies at the border.
The provided cumulative expenditure figures excludes the related overhead and project management costs for the period from 2021/04/30 to 2021/06/30
The provided cumulative expenditure figures excludes the related overhead and project management costs for the period from 2021/07/30 to 2021/09/30
The provided cumulative expenditure figures excludes the related overhead and project management costs for the period from 2021/10/31 to 2021/12/31
The provided cumulative expenditure figures excludes the related overhead and project management costs for the period from 2022/04/30 to 2022/06/30
